metadata.title: CVE-2019-1010127 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
VCFTools vcftools prior to version 0.1.15 is affected by: Use-after-free.The impact is: Denial of Service or possibly other impact (eg. codeexecution or information disclosure). The component is: Theheader::add_FILTER_descriptor method in header.cpp. The attack vector is:The victim must open a specially crafted VCF file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-1010127` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

vcftools - 0.1.11+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: vcftools package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.1.11+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1~esm1').
